cluster_relations.rel_desc: Caterpillars help maintain the balance of plant populations.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject plays a role in maintaining or stabilizing the object state or process.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies serving as a food source contributes to biodiversity.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has a causal or supporting effect on the emergence, level, or quality of the object.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has a causal or supporting effect on the emergence, level, or quality of the object.
args.justification: The relation describes a general ecological causal/supporting effect (caterpillars helping maintain plant population balance), which is semantically aligned with a broad 'contributes_to' predicate. Using 'contributes_to_maintenance_of' introduces an unnecessary specialization compared to the other instance in this cluster (RelR_c8f43fb41026), which already uses 'contributes_to' with an appropriate generic description for the same ecological-effect relation class. Normalizing both to 'contributes_to' improves schema consistency while preserving the causal semantics.
